title: News regarding LuxeBrands
story_body:
LuxeBrands Appoints New Regional Marketing Director for Asia-Pacific

LuxeBrands Holdings Inc. (NYSE: LUXE) announced today the appointment of Sarah Chen as Regional Marketing Director for Asia-Pacific, effective January 15. Chen will be based in the company's Singapore office and report directly to Global Marketing Chief Marcus Williams.

Chen joins LuxeBrands from rival beauty conglomerate Prestige International, where she spent eight years in various marketing roles, most recently as Senior Brand Manager for the Southeast Asian market. She holds an MBA from INSEAD and brings over 15 years of experience in luxury beauty marketing.

"Sarah's deep understanding of Asian consumer preferences and her track record in digital marketing make her an excellent addition to our leadership team," Williams said in a statement. "As we continue to strengthen our presence in Asia-Pacific, her expertise will be invaluable."

The appointment comes as LuxeBrands seeks to expand its footprint in the rapidly growing Asian beauty market, which currently accounts for approximately 35 percent of the company's global revenue.

In related news, LuxeBrands will be participating in the upcoming Global Beauty Summit in Paris next month. Chief Executive Officer Patricia Morrison is scheduled to deliver a keynote address on sustainable packaging innovations on February 8. The company will also host a booth showcasing its latest product lines and conducting meetings with international distributors.

Additionally, LuxeBrands announced the launch of its "Beauty with Purpose" campaign, a new marketing initiative aimed at highlighting the company's commitment to clean beauty and ethical sourcing. The campaign will roll out across digital and traditional media channels in North America and Europe beginning in March.

As part of its ongoing environmental efforts, LuxeBrands also unveiled plans to introduce refillable packaging options for its top-selling skincare line by the third quarter of 2024. The initiative is expected to reduce plastic waste by an estimated 15 percent across the product range.

The company maintains its full-year guidance, expecting revenue growth of 6-8 percent and adjusted earnings per share of $3.45-$3.55 for fiscal 2024.

LuxeBrands shares closed at $67.23 on Tuesday, up 0.4 percent. The stock has gained 12 percent year-to-date, in line with the broader luxury goods sector.
